thread.title: Editorial week in review: Oct. 19-24
thread.title_full: Editorial week in review: Oct. 19-24 | OregonLive.com

author: The Oregonian Editorial Board
title: Editorial week in review: Oct. 19-24
text:
Monday, Oct. 19
Grotto debate: The Portland School Board should take up a discussion and involve the public on the school district's decision to pull school choirs from The Grotto's Christmas Festival of Lights.
Tuesday, Oct. 20
Business regulations: A single rule change can have far-reaching consequences for small businesses.
Wednesday, Oct. 21
Pot's protectionism: Regulators will thwart development of Oregon's new recreational marijuana market if the limit out-of-state investment and pot-shop ownership.
Cougar hunting : With Oregon's population of cougars growing, it's time to let rural Oregonians use dogs to hunt them.
Thursday, Oct. 22
Troutdale secrecy: Troutdale City Council lost trust when it hid the purchase a gun used in the Reynolds High School shooting.
Friday, Oct. 23
Police body cameras: Police officers under investigation should not get special treatment to watch body camera footage before giving a statement to investigators.
Free but costly: A rental car upgrade signals the collision between business practice and environmental impact. A sketchbook by editorial board member Len Reed.
Saturday, Oct. 24
Editorial peaks and valleys: An editorial look at the week's highs and lows in the news.
